title: Angelina Jolie celebrates Maleficent 2 premiere with kids
text:
Angelina Jolie with children Vivienne, Zahara, Shiloh and Knox at the Maleficent: Mistress Of Evil premiere (Picture: Reuters)

Angelina Jolie was joined by four of her children in London on Wednesday to celebrate the premiere of Maleficent: Mistress Of Evil, the sequel of the hit Sleeping Beauty retelling.

Twins Vivienne and Knox were both in attendance, looking comfy in a jumpsuit and suit respectively, while 13-year-old Shiloh kept warm in trousers and a silk bomber jacket.

Zahara, 14, however, made the most of the glamorous occasion and wore a metallic ball gown with layers of tulle with a dramatic black nail and teal accent nail.

Angelina, who beamed for the cameras as she posed with her youngest children, wore a stunning sequined silver gown with accented shoulder pads and gold harnessing around the chest.

She added a bold red lip and wore her hair slicked back in a bun.

Zahara, 14, made the most of the glamorous occasion (Picture: Getty)

The family were all smiles (Picture: Reuters)

Angelina Jolie was joined by four of her children in London (Picture: Backgrid)

The 44-year-old actress walked the red carpet with co-star Elle Fanning.

Elle also stuck to the fairytale theme and wore a sea-green gown with a metallic corset and netting which covered her arms.

Elle also stuck to the fairytale theme (Picture: Rex)

Angelina’s eldest son Maddox, 18, had joined the actress at the Tokyo premiere from university in Seoul.

On Tuesday Zahara and Shiloh were the only two to join their mum in Rome.

Angelina Jolie gives daughter Zahara a smile (Picture: Rex)

Five years after first donning the evil fairy’s horns in 2014, Ange has returned as Maleficent in soon-to-be-released Mistress Of Evil.

And this time she will be fighting for the love of Princess Aurora (Elle Fanning).

The villain is set to meet her match in the form of Queen Ingrith (played by Michelle Pfeiffer) who causes drama of explosive proportions when her son Prince Phillip proposes to Aurora.

Ahead of the release, Ange has spoken about the similarities between her own struggles and that of Maleficent’s, referencing the breakdown of her marriage to Brad Pitt in 2016.

Speaking to French magazine Madame, she explained: ‘I don’t what my fate holds but what I am convinced of is that I am in a period of transition, like a return to my roots, a return to myself. Because, I had lost myself a bit.

‘I felt a deep and genuine sadness, I was hurt.’

Maleficent: Mistress Of Evil is in UK cinemas 18 October.
